content.question: Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows the power <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> delivered to an object over the time interval indicated which results in change in energy <math alttext="delta E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows the power <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> delivered to an identical object over the same time interval which results in change in energy <math alttext="delta E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="delta E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="delta E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta E sub 1 is less than delta E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because the final power <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is less than the final power <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta E sub 1 is less than delta E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because the slope is negative in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and positive in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="delta E sub 1 equals delta E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because the area bounded by the function and the horizontal axis is the same in both graphs

<math alttext="delta E sub 1 equals delta E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because the magnitude of the slope is the same in both graphs

content.answer: <math alttext="delta E sub 1 equals delta E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because the area bounded by the function and the horizontal axis is the same in both graphs

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
